title: Affordable Travel Plans for Every Budget
content:
1. Northeast Road Trip on a Budget
Route
New York City - Philadelphia - Baltimore - Washington, D.C.


Highlights & Savings Tips
Accommodation: Opt for hostels in major cities like HI NYC Hostel or use Airbnb in less touristy neighborhoods. Look for "shared room" options to cut costs significantly.


Transportation: Travel by bus. Megabus and Greyhound offer tickets as low as $5 if booked in advance. Renting a car for the whole trip is costly; instead, use public transit in each city. The Metro in Washington, D.C., and SEPTA in Philadelphia are affordable and convenient.
Attractions: Many iconic spots are free. Visit Central Park in New York, Independence Hall and the Liberty Bell in Philadelphia, and the Smithsonian museums in Washington, D.C., which have no entry fees. Explore Baltimore's Inner Harbor, a great place for a free stroll with street performers and views of the water.


Food: Try local diners and food trucks. In New York, grab a slice of pizza for under $5; in Philadelphia, hunt for budget - friendly cheesesteaks at local joints. Grocery stores like Trader Joe’s are perfect for packing picnic lunches.

2. Southwest National Parks Adventure
Route
Las Vegas - Grand Canyon National Park - Sedona - Zion National Park


Highlights & Savings Tips
Accommodation: Camping is a great option in national parks. At Grand Canyon National Park, Mather Campground offers affordable spots starting at $18 per night. In Sedona, look for budget motels outside the city center.


Transportation: Rent a car, but split the cost with travel companions. Compare prices on rental car aggregator websites. Consider taking the shuttle buses within national parks, which are often free or low - cost.


Attractions: Purchase an America the Beautiful National Parks Pass for $80. It provides access to all national parks for a year, saving you money if you visit multiple parks. Hiking trails in all these parks are free and offer stunning views.
Food: Stock up on supplies at Walmart or local grocery
section: That affordable travel is not a distant dream but an achievable reality.
